H0.text: when did the democratic party change its name. The 1840s

H1.text: when did the democratic party change its name. The 1850s

H2.text: when did the democratic party change its name. The 1820s

H3.text: when did the democratic party change its name. the 1830s

A4.text: During the Jacksonian era, the term 'The Democracy' was in use by the party, but the name 'Democratic Party' was eventually settled upon and became the official name in 1844.

A5.text: The Democratic-Republican Party splintered in 1824 into the short-lived National Republican Party and the Jacksonian movement which in 1828 became the Democratic Party.

A7.text: The coalition of Jacksonians, Calhounites, and Crawfordites built by Andrew Jackson and Martin Van Buren coalesced into the Democratic Party, which dominated presidential politics in the decades prior to the Civil War.
